comment.body: If you want to be anonymous, sign up for a new ZeroID in Tor Browser. Your IP leaks in both cases you mentioned.

You can read the updated [docs](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiDoBP8RiWziqiBGEd8tQMy66A6fmnw2V/big/docs/usage/) of ZeroMux, the big file loader. It calls back the `onfinish` function when it is done. You can load the blob into a PDF. Don't forget to change the blob content type. Instructions can be found in the docs.
- - -
Btw, It seems that you are including the `daemon.js`. You don't need that file if you are not working with videos, since `daemon.js` is sort of a background worker that appends data to the **video** Source Buffer. If anything does not work, feel free to mention me and tell me about it.

It seems that you are using the original `ui.js`. To make the UI satisfy your need, you need to modify the blob content type and the `onfinish` function. More specifically, you just need to modify `events.otherParams = {"blobType": "application/pdf"};` and the `showPlayer` function. The `url` parameter is the blob url.
IFrame Sandbox is a pretty new HTML5 feature, and different browser implements it differently. Sometimes there are even bugs on handling file downloading.
Hold and drag the `0` button to the left. If you select "This is my site," you will find a place to put your site title.

@KosherX: After you made changes, you have to press `Sign`. After ZeroNet signed your site using your private key, you have push `Publish`. People who don't have your private key cannot sign your site, and ZeroNet clients will not accept contents with invalid signature.
